SHORT_DESCR.P: The Council has awarded a DLO Subcontractor Framework consisting of the following 6 lots:

MAIN_SITE.P: Various properties throughout Caerphilly County Borough.

SHORT_DESCR.P: The Council awarded a framework agreement to Contractors to provide labour and materials to support the Council’s own in-house workforce in the undertaking of the Welsh Housing Quality Standard (WHQS) works which includes Heating and Mechanical Works.

MAIN_SITE.P: Various properties throughout Caerphilly County Borough.

SHORT_DESCR.P: The Council awarded a framework agreement to Contractors to provide labour and materials to support the Council’s own in-house workforce in the undertaking of the Welsh Housing Quality Standard (WHQS) works which includes Electrical Works.

MAIN_SITE.P: Various properties throughout Caerphilly County Borough.

SHORT_DESCR.P: The Council awarded a framework agreement to Contractors to provide labour and materials to support the Council’s own in-house workforce in the undertaking of the Welsh Housing Quality Standard (WHQS) works which includes Painting Works.

MAIN_SITE.P: Various properties throughout Caerphilly County Borough.

SHORT_DESCR.P: The Council awarded a framework agreement to Contractors to provide labour and materials to support the Council’s own in-house workforce in the undertaking of the Welsh Housing Quality Standard (WHQS) works which includes Wall Tiling Works.

MAIN_SITE.P: Various properties throughout Caerphilly County Borough.

SHORT_DESCR.P: The Council awarded a framework agreement to Contractors to provide labour and materials to support the Council’s own in-house workforce in the undertaking of the Welsh Housing Quality Standard (WHQS) works which includes Sheet Floor Covering Works.

MAIN_SITE.P: Various properties throughout Caerphilly County Borough.

SHORT_DESCR.P: The Council awarded a framework agreement to Contractors to provide labour and materials to support the Council’s own in-house workforce in the undertaking of the Welsh Housing Quality Standard (WHQS) works which includes Asbestos Removal and Disposal.

INFO_ADD.P: A number of inconsistencies have been identified between the ITT and the framework agreement. The draft framework used for this process utilised a similar unconnected agreement and it is found that some areas were not removed. Therefore by way of variations the inconsistences will be removed from the framework agreement. None of the variations alter the requirements of the ITT but bring the terms of the framework agreement inline with the ITT and OJEU Notice.
Schedule 3.
Section 6.
Previously: Minimum value of any one order to be issued GBP 40. Maximum value of any one order to be issued GBP 24 999.
Amended: There will be no minimum or maximum order values.
Section 7.

Previously: Approximate anticipated value of work to be carried out under the whole of the framework: GBP 1 000 000 per annum. This figure is for guidance only and does not impose any commitment on the Employer to issue orders for any value of work whatsoever.
Amended: Approximate anticipated value of work to be carried out under the whole of the framework: is GBP 4 500 000 over the framework duration broken down as follows:
— Lot 1: Heating and Mechanical: GBP 1 300 000,
— Lot 2: Electrical: GBP 1 400 000,
— Lot 3: Painting: GBP 500 000,
— Lot 4: Wall Tiling: GBP 300 000,
— Lot 5: Vinyl sheet flooring: GBP 500 000, and
— Lot 6: Asbestos removal: GBP 500 000.
These figures are for guidance only and do not impose any commitment on the Employer to issue Orders for any value of work whatsoever.
Section 8.
Previously:
Orders — Priority coding:
The following priority coding applies to orders:
A: Same Day: Emergency Repairs and Maintenance Works. Before the end of the day order is placed.
B: Appointment Work: Repairs and Maintenance works where a specific time and day for completion is arranged with the tenant or leaseholder. According To Appointment Stated (Between 2 and 25 days).
C: Routine Work: All other Repairs and Maintenance works. Within 20 days.
D: Non-Routine Work: Larger-scale Reactive and Planned Works where a quantity of works are required in 1 property. Between 5 and 66 days.
Amended:

Contractors will be required to undertake elements of work, all directly awarded contract packages will detail the works duration and required completion dates in line with the in house contract programme.
The Council shall monitor the following Key Performance Indicators (“KPIs”) as part of this framework agreement. The KPIs are applicable to all lots of the framework agreement.
The following Key Performance Information applies to orders:
Kitchen Renewal/refurbishment — 10 days — each element of work will be completed within the required timescale.
Bathroom renewal/refurbishment — 5 days — each element of work will be completed within the required timescale.
Wetroom renewal/refurbishment — 7 days — each element of work will be completed within the required timescale.
Full Electrical Rewire — 2 days — or in line with the In house works programme.
Full Heating system — 2 days — or in line with the In house works programme.
Kitchen refurbishment, Bathroom refurbishment, Wetroom Rewire Heating 20 days: each element will be completed within the required timescale or in line with the In house works programme.
Section 13.
Previously:
Valuation — Percentage additions:
Where not included in or annexed to the Schedule of Hourly Charges, the percentage additions to the invoice price of non-labour items are as follows:
— overheads and profit on materials: as tendered by the contractor.
— overheads and profit on plant, services and consumable stores: as tendered by the contractor,
— overheads and profit on subcontractors: included in the applicable Schedule of Rates.
Amended:
Valuation — Percentage additions:
Material and plant items charged at invoice on face value only all overheads and profits recovered in day work costs:
— overheads and profit on materials: as tendered by the contractor.
— overheads and profit on plant, services and consumable stores: as tendered by the Contractor.
